Emergency Dentist Miami Beach FL

0:00 / 0:00

We Open After hours for Your dental emergencies

Crack a Smile, Not a Tooth!

If you are suddenly feeling intense pain in your mouth, don’t ignore it! Dental emergencies can happen at the most inconvenient times, but that doesn’t mean you should have to suffer through the pain. Very often, tooth or gum pain will just get worse if it is not tended too quickly.
Your Smile Creator has you covered with our emergency dental services. We will fit you into our schedule at the first moment possible, so we can help you get out of pain and so you can avoid further damage to your smile.

See the Emergency Dentistry Services We Provide

ready for a visit?

Please call us at 305-902-4270 or contact us to request an appointment.

appointment

Emergency Dental
Services We Offer

With immediate and expert dental care, your oral health problems can be resolved before they worsen. Whether you are in need of a major fix or a minor repair, you can call our team of dedicated emergency dentists serving Miami Beach. Our focus will be on relieving your pain quickly, so you can return to living your life.
We offer emergency dental services including treatment of:

  1. Cracked or broken tooth
  2. Loosened tooth
  3. Abscesses
  4. Tooth pain
  5. Lost filling, crown or bridge
  6. Extremely swollen gums or jaw
  7. Cuts inside the mouth that won’t quit bleeding
  8. Gum or tooth infection

With immediate and expert dental care, your oral health problems can be resolved before they worsen. Whether you are in need of a major fix or a minor repair, you can call our team of dedicated emergency dentists serving Miami Beach. Our focus will be on relieving your pain quickly, so you can return to living your life.
We offer emergency dental services including treatment of:

A Dental Emergency for You
is Our Emergency, Too!

What can we do if we see you on an emergency basis? We will start right away by diagnosing the cause of your problem. Your dental emergency could result from something as simple as a stuck piece of food that can’t be removed with floss. We will find it, remove it and disinfect the area.
If your dental emergency consists of an abscess, we can relieve your pain and, if needed, provide you with antibiotics. This should improve your tooth pain until you can schedule a regular office visit for a more complete resolution. A broken tooth may be able to be repaired and a loosened tooth can be secured in the jaw, so healing can start. When a person is seen by an emergency dentist quickly enough after knocking out a tooth, it might be possible to clean that tooth and restore it to the jaw bone. This action must take place within 30 minutes.
We have the skills and the facilities to repair your unexpected injury or dental damage and relieve your pain. Then we can schedule you for further appointments to complete your treatment.
If you have trouble finding an emergency dentist in Miami Beach, please call Family & Cosmetic Dentistry Wellness Spa in Bay Harbor Islands, FL. We will see a patient in pain even during evening hours.

Unexpected Events Happen

No matter how well you might take care of your teeth, accidents or injuries to the teeth or mouth can happen. Very often, these injuries take place during athletic activities or car accidents.
We know very well that when you need emergency dental care in Miami, it can be difficult to find emergency dentists that will see you right away. In every case possible, we see those needing emergency dentistry on the same day they call us.
Some dentists who do offer emergency dental care will only offer the care to those people who are established patients. This is not so at Family & Cosmetic Dentistry Wellness Spa. We will help you to the best of our ability, whether you are an established patient or new to our practice.
When emergencies happen after hours, you might wonder what your options are. By calling our emergency dentistry line, we will work fast to get you the care that you need as quickly as possible.

What to Do Until You Can Get Emergency Dentistry

  • Toothache: Floss gently to remove food particles, then make a mixture of salt and warm water. Rinse your mouth with this mixture repeatedly. Use an over-the-counter pain reliever as needed.
  • Broken tooth: If the tooth is bleeding, press gauze or a soft towel on the area until bleeding stops. Put a cold pack on the outside of your cheek to reduce pain.
  • Knocked out tooth: If possible, replace the tooth in its socket. If not, store the tooth in milk or hold it inside the cheek. Never touch the tooth by the root but just by the hard, white crown. Get to a dentist the first minute possible. If the tooth can be restored to its socket within 30 minutes, it may be able to be saved. It may still require root canal therapy afterwards.
  • Lost crown or bridge: Purchase dental cement at a pharmacy. (NEVER use Superglue or any other glue.) Place this cement inside the crown or bridge and fit it back in place. Bite down gently when the crown or bridge seems to fit well. Wipe away any cement that gets squeezed out. Note: A damaged crown or bridge may not be able to be cemented back in place.
  • Lost filling: To protect a tooth after a filling has been lost, spread dental cement across the damaged area to protect it. Avoid chewing in this area.

Dr. Anatoly Ripa and his staff are very accustomed to offering emergency dentist’s care. We are proud to offer emergency dental services to Miami, FL.

$99 New Patient Cleaning

I Am Due for A Cleaning

Serving You Dentally, So You Can Rest Mentally

One of the most important steps for maintaining healthy teeth and oral structures is to visit us twice every year for a complete dental checkup. These routine visits allow our experts to keep track of your oral health and to administer timely treatment in the event that any issues are discovered.
Our dental checkups include a professional teeth cleaning, digital X-rays when necessary and an oral cancer screening. Patients are expected to see a dentist every six months for a checkup to stay healthy.

I Am Due for A Cleaning
01

Protecting Your Health, Preserving Your Teeth

Each time we see a patient in our Bay Harbor Islands office, we look for problems like tooth decay or gum disease. Seeing a patient at least twice every year means we can treat cavities while they are tiny and gum disease as soon as it starts. By eliminating these problems immediately, we help each patient maintain good dental and oral health.
We also have a chance to educate our patients on any changes they should make in their at-home care regimen. This is also an essential part of maintaining good dental health.
All these actions work together, so we can help our patients to preserve their teeth for their whole lives. At the same time, we foster an atmosphere of friendliness and welcome that makes every visit as pleasurable as possible. We want our patients to look forward to their next dental visits.

02

Professional Teeth Cleaning

Sometimes referred to as prophylaxis, a professional cleaning is an effective way to rid the mouth of harmful plaque and tartar. We use special dental tools to clean the patient’s gums and teeth, including all surfaces of their teeth and below their gum line.
Next, surface stains are eliminated by cleansing and polishing the teeth. This thorough cleaning process leaves the patient with reduced bad breath and a long-lasting sense of oral freshness. We also use this opportunity to check the patient’s mouth for any signs or symptoms of tooth decay or gum disease. Every patient is also examined for any signs of mouth cancer.

Our novelties

Intraoral Cameras

Your Smile Creator in Bay Harbor Islands, FL, we keep up with the latest dental technology, so your treatment is always state-of-the-art. For that reason, we have equipped our office with intraoral cameras to ensure thorough treatment of any issue with your teeth and gums.
This handheld camera fits inside your mouth to record sharp images of every tooth as well as the shape of your gums and mouth. As an extra benefit, we can also show you any problems clearly during your dental exam. You can vividly see the inside of your mouth and every tooth!
An intraoral camera can also be used in place of the gummy impression trays we used to use when planning bridges, crowns, or Invisalign treatment. That’s a benefit our patients love!

3D X-Rays

With 3D X-rays, we can plan the most precise care for our patients. There are times when we need to be able to visualize the shape and density of every inch of bone or know exactly where every nerve is. When it comes to placing dental implants, this type of X-ray is invaluable. We can discover exactly where to place an implant and whether or not a bone graft is needed before placement. If we are going to perform a procedure like a sinus lift, this type of imaging is essential.
We can also clearly detect infections or other pathologies that could be missed with conventional X-rays. Being able to offer 3D X-rays is another way we make sure we can keep our patients in very good health.
We continually invest in updated dental equipment, so we can protect the health of every patient that comes to us. With 3D X-rays, we can also keep your exposure to X-rays minimal because one scan obtains a complete picture of your mouth and jaws.

About AIRFLOW

Biofilm: Biofilm is a watery coating of different types of bacteria that live in your mouth. Biofilm accumulates on your teeth and is the sticky, smelly coating you brush away in the morning. Brushing alone is not able to remove 100% of this film, which is why you need professional cleanings from time to time.

Young calculus: Minerals in your saliva plus biofilm form plaque, a semi-hardened accumulation that is deposited on your teeth. When this plaque is not cleaned away, it hardens further into calculus. This is the substance your dental hygienist scrapes off your teeth during a cleaning. While this calculus is still young and has not fully hardened, the AIRFLOW system cleans it away.

Stains: AIRFLOW cleaning is able to remove heavy stains resulting from consumption of colored drinks like coffee, tea and red wine. Even stains from tobacco use can be cleared away.

Try AirFlow Cleaning Today
0:00 / 0:00

Polishing, Too

Polishing, Too

When you get your teeth cleaned at your dentist’s office, it’s likely that your hygienist uses hand tools and a sonic cleaner on all the surfaces of your teeth and then follows this with polishing. The AIRFLOW system does two steps at once, incorporating both sonic cleaning and polishing. Completing two types of cleaning in one step saves you time. You may also find the AIRFLOW cleaning system more comfortable than earlier types of dental cleaning you’ve had.
A dental hygienist typically follows AIRFLOW cleaning with manual cleaning of any tough, hardened spots of calculus.

Your Smile Creator
is Accepting New Patients

The staff and personnel of Your Smile Creator work diligently to ensure that your first visit is one of comfort, care, and relief. Our staff is trained to take care of all your requisite dental needs. Our staff accommodates you by answering any concerns you may have through a thorough review of your medical and dental history. Additionally, our trained specialists perform a comprehensive scope of any dental complications and concerns in your dental history and document any complications and worries you may have before you enter our office.

Then we follow these steps:

  1. Place a protective rubber sheet around the tooth to keep the tooth dry and to help prevent the infection from spreading to other areas of the mouth.
  2. Make an opening in the top of a tooth, just like what is done when a tooth receives a filling.
  3. Remove the soft pulp that fills the canals in the middle of the roots, all the way to the tip of the tooth.
  4. Clean and shape the canals, so they can easily be filled with biocompatible material.
  5. Clean and shape the canals, so they can easily be filled with biocompatible material.
  6. Place a filling in the top of the tooth.

The Many Causes
of Bad Breath

To work out how to get rid of bad breath permanently, a dentist must start by determining which of the many causes is at work. They may take into account the following possibilities:

  • Dry mouth
  • Tooth, gum or mouth infections
  • Gum disease
  • Sinus infections
  • Poor dental hygiene
  • Smoking
  • Eating strong-smelling foods like garlic
  • Reflux disease
  • Medications
  • Poorly-cleaned dental appliances
  • Pneumonia
  • Tonsil stones
  • Liver problems
  • Parasites
  • Certain diets

As you can see, bad breath from the stomach, sinuses and other parts of the body may be the cause. The problem may not originate in the mouth.

Treating Halitosis

Dr. Ripa is ready to help you find the right cause, so you know how to get rid of halitosis. He knows that there are actually 72 different causes of halitosis. There are a number of tests he performs to zero in on the correct causes, including:

  1. Microscope in-vitro test This test looks for anaerobic bacteria (ones that do not require oxygen) that might exist in the mouth and that can be eliminated with liquid ozone. This treatment restores the proper bacterial flora in the mouth.
  2. Salivary cultures A test for pathogens in the saliva can detect diseases in the mouth or elsewhere in the body. This test also determines the quantity and quality of saliva being produced.
  3. Arterial oxygen saturation If inadequate amounts of oxygen are being carried in arterial blood, it can permit an overpopulation of anaerobic bacteria in the mouth.
  4. HaliSens test and scoring. If inadequate amounts of oxygen are being carried in arterial blood, it can permit an overpopulation of anaerobic bacteria in the mouth.
  5. Test for mycosis This is a test for fungal overgrowth that can be treated with an antifungal medication.
  6. Test for parasites or viral infections. This will be treated appropriately.

Once the correct cause or causes are found, you’ll know how to get rid of halitosis. Your treatment can also be lasting. Dr. Ripa has assembled a talented and experienced interdisciplinary team of practitioners who can help you remedy the problem and achieve better health at the same time.

Teeth Whitening Bay Harbor

0:00 / 0:00

Whiten Your Teeth, Brighten Your Life White, shiny teeth are an essential component of any great smile. For patients who want to whiten their teeth, professional teeth whitening treatments are an ideal solution. The professional teeth whitening procedure is easier and more effective than ever before, with the availability of whitening gel, professional and gel whitening procedures have helped millions of people achieve a more youthful and energetic look that radiates with strength and well being. Let our team at Your Smile Creator in Bay Harbor Islands near North Miami, FL brighten your smile!

  4. HaliSens test and scoring. If inadequate amounts of oxygen are being carried in arterial blood, it can permit an overpopulation of anaerobic bacteria in the mouth.
  5. Test for mycosis This is a test for fungal overgrowth that can be treated with an antifungal medication.
  6. Test for parasites or viral infections. This will be treated appropriately.
